=== Mathematics ===
* <nowiki>[[http://gnudatalanguage.sourceforge.net/|GDL]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/gnudatalanguage|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]]- GNU Data Language is a high level language for numerical computations and data visualization similar to IDL (Interactive Data Language from Research Systems Inc.).

* <nowiki>[[Octave]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/octave|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - GNU Octave is a high-level language, primarily intended for numerical computations. (Similar to <nowiki>[[MATLAB]]</nowiki>). <nowiki>[[http://www.octave.org/|Octave]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.scicraft.org/|SciCraft]]</nowiki> - Add-on to Octave, clones Simulink. Still in development, blocks have to be written by the user. It is supposed to specialize in bioinformatics functions.

* <nowiki>[[http://scilab.org/|Scilab]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/scilab|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/important.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - Another MATLAB-like application.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.scicos.org/|SciCos]]</nowiki> - A free Simulink-like add-on to Scilab.

* <nowiki>[[http://maxima.sourceforge.net/|Maxima]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/maxima|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - A computer algebra system (xmaxima is its X interface).
** <nowiki>[[http://wxmaxima.sourceforge.net/|wxMaxima]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/wxmaxima|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - A nice front end for Maxima.
** The wxmaxima package doesn't work in Ubuntu 6.06. Please go to the <nowiki>[[wxMaxima]]</nowiki> page in this wiki for a work around.
** Here is a <nowiki>[[http://arxiv.org/html/cs.SC/0504039|tutorial]]</nowiki> about using Te''''''Xmacs as a Maxima frontend
** <nowiki>[[http://members3.jcom.home.ne.jp/imaxima/|imaxima]]</nowiki> embeds a Maxima session in Emacs and uses <nowiki>[[LaTeX]]</nowiki> to render output

* <nowiki>[[http://www.mathomatic.org/|Mathomatic]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/mathomatic|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - A small, easy to use, command-line computer algebra system.

* <nowiki>[[https://gmplib.org/|GNU MP]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/libgmp3c2|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/ubuntu_grey.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - GNU Multi-Precision arithmetic library. Useful if you need to use very big numbers in a C program.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/|GSL]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/gsl-bin|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - The Gnu Scientific Library.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.ooomacros.org/user.php#106652|OOStatistics]]</nowiki> - A statistics macro for OpenOffice Calc.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.freefem.org/|freefem]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/freefem|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - A partial differential equation oriented language using Finite Element Method - 2D and 3D versions.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.openfoam.org/|OpenFOAM]]</nowiki> - A former commercial computational fluid dynamics code that is now under GPL, see end of this page and
** <nowiki>[[OpenFOAM]]</nowiki> has instructions on how to install OpenFOAM on Ubuntu.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.scipy.org/|SciPy]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/python-scipy|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - An open source library of scientific tools for Python.
** <nowiki>[[http://www.scipy.org/Cookbook|SciPy CookBook]]</nowiki>
** A <nowiki>[[http://www.scipy.org/Topical_Software|wiki page]]</nowiki> similar to this one.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.sympy.org/|SymPy]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/python-sympy|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - An open source computer algebra system (CAS) for Python.

* <nowiki>[[http://cens.ioc.ee/projects/f2py2e/|F2PY]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/python-f2py|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - Fortran to Python interface generator provides a connection between Python and Fortran languages.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.ginac.de/|GiNaC]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/ginac-tools|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - C++ library for symbolic computations.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.sagemath.org/|SAGE]]</nowiki> - An open source computer algebra system. Their goal is to create a viable free and open source alternative to the commercial programs Magma, Maple, Mathematica, and MATLAB.

* <nowiki>[[Mathematica]]</nowiki> - A proprietary computer algebra system. <nowiki>[[http://www.mathematica.com|Mathematica]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[Maple]]</nowiki> - A proprietary computer algebra system. <nowiki>[[http://www.maplesoft.com|Maple]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://www.exelisvis.com/ProductsServices/IDL.aspx|IDL]]</nowiki> - A proprietary data visualization & data analysis platform.

* <nowiki>[[MATLAB]]</nowiki> - A proprietary numerical computing environment and programming language .<nowiki>[[http://www.mathworks.com/|MATLAB]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[GeoGebra]]</nowiki> - A free and multi-platform dynamic mathematics software for schools that joins geometry, algebra and calculus. It received several international awards including the European and German educational software awards. <nowiki>[[http://www.geogebra.org/|Geogebra]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://pdl.perl.org/|PDL]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/pdl|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - Perl Data Language is a powerful data mathematics and data manipulation package for Perl.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.mupad.de/|Mupad]]</nowiki> - A proprietary computer algebra system.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.clucalc.info/|Clucalc]]</nowiki> - A tool for 3D visualisations, Clifford algebras and scientific calculations.

* <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/projects/auto2000|AUTO 2000]]</nowiki> - Software for continuation and bifurcation problems in ordinary differential equations.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.gap-system.org/|GAP - Groups, Algorithms, Programming]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/gap|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - a System for Computational Discrete Algebra.

* <nowiki>[[http://pari.math.u-bordeaux.fr/|Pari/GP]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/pari-gp|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - designed for fast computations in number theory.

* <nowiki>[[http://www.mathematik.uni-muenchen.de/~forster/sw/aribas.html|Aribas]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/aribas|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - an interactive interpreter for big integer arithmetic and multi-precision floating point arithmetic

* <nowiki>[[http://yacas.sourceforge.net/|Yacas]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/yacas|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - an easy to use, general purpose Computer Algebra System, a program for symbolic manipulation of mathematical expressions.

* <nowiki>[[http://cadabra.phi-sci.com/|Cadabra]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/cadabra|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - a field-theory motivated approach to computer algebra.

* <nowiki>[[http://home.gna.org/veusz/|Veusz]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/veusz|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - GUI scientific plotting and graphing package.

==== Statistics ====

* <nowiki>[[http://www.spss.com/|SPSS]]</nowiki> The proprietary statistical reference package. Written in Java, since version 16 (currently 17) runs on Linux, although it has some problems with Compiz Fusion ('''Solution''':  ''sudo gedit /etc/environment''. Add at the end: ''AWT_TOOLKIT="MToolkit"''. Save and restart). 

* <nowiki>[[http://www.gnu.org/software/pspp/|PSPP/PSPPIRE]]</nowiki>  It is intended as a free replacement of the proprietary program SPSS. PSPPIRE is the PSPP GUI.  

* <nowiki>[[http://www.r-project.org/|R]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/r-base|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - for statistical computing and graphics.
** <nowiki>[[https://www.rforge.net/JGR/|JGR]]</nowiki> - Java GUI for R.
** <nowiki>[[http://rkward.sourceforge.net/|RKWard]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/rkward|<nowiki>[[File:IconsPage/community.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] - An easy to use, transparent front end to the R language.
** <nowiki>[[http://www.stat.auckland.ac.nz/~ihaka/120/|Some R tutorials and examples]]</nowiki>.
** <nowiki>[[http://addictedtor.free.fr/graphiques/|R Graph Gallery]]</nowiki> - Collection of graphics that can be created using R. Includes the R commands used to create the graphics.

* <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/projects/odstatistics/|ODStatistics]]</nowiki> - a set of LibreOffice macros for descriptive statistics
